messages.subject: Re: allergies
messages.msgSnippet: Bridget: How did you pinpoint your specific allergies?  I have MAJOR suger cravings and processed carbo cravings.  My niece was recently diagnosed with PCOS
messages.messageBody:
Bridget:
How did you pinpoint your specific allergies? I have MAJOR suger cravings
and processed carbo cravings. My niece was recently diagnosed with PCOS
(poly-cystene-ovarian syndrome). They told her the underlying cause was
insulin resistance. And that her condition is most certainly genetic. I
seem to have many of the conditions of this syndrome.....just thinking about
exploring this.

Also, my 1 yr old son has had excema from the get-go. Where have people
gotten info regarding realtionship with food. He's breastfed, could my
diet effect his excema?
Susan, who has been able to establish relatively healthy disciplines for
most things, but cannot seem to control sugar/carb cravings in the least.

My "old man Physician" explained in very technical terms about allergies
and how they can (in some cases but not all) often cause cravings similar
to an alcoholics craving for booze. I forget now the reasons behind it,
but I know from experience that it can be true. He also warned me to be
expecially careful with the alcohol I drank. I am allergic to corn and
crave it. I also come from a family with a high history of alcoholism.
He said I should stay far away from corn-mash bourbons. I did, but
mostly because I have tastes for other things and don't drink much
anyway.

Bridget
